alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 12:53PM MST until August 18 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including portions of Coconino and Yavapai counties. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... JD Dam Wash, Volunteer Wash, Tule Tank Wash, Sycamore Creek, Bear Canyon and Hell Canyon. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Horse Lake Campground and Raymond Boy Scout Camp and portions fo the Rafael Fire scar. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
